items.title: Steam’s Next Fest is full of weird-ass, cool-ass games
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Steam Next Fest is ongoing until March 3rd, featuring numerous indie game demos.
- Key demos highlighted include:
  - **The Talos Principle: Reawakened**: A remaster adding new story content and puzzle editor.
  - **Bundle of Joy**: A narrative game about new parenthood during the pandemic with a focus on empathy.
  - **Creepy Redneck Dinosaur Mansion 3**: A comedic metroidvania with match-3 mechanics, featuring an amusing storyline.
  - **Promise Mascot Agency**: A bizarre game where a disgraced yakuza manages a mascot business to help revive a town.
- The event showcases unique game concepts that may defy traditional explanations but foster creativity among developers.

items.title: Mozilla says its new Firefox terms don’t give it ownership of your data
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Mozilla introduced new Terms of Use for Firefox that faced criticism for suggesting ownership over user data.
- Users raised concerns over the phrase granting Mozilla a nonexclusive, royalty-free license to use user-uploaded information.
- Mozilla clarified that the terms are necessary for basic functionality, stating it does not claim ownership over user data beyond what is specified in their Privacy Notice.
- The language choices were explained: 'nonexclusive' indicates users retain rights, 'royalty-free' reflects the free nature of Firefox, and 'worldwide' signifies global availability.
- Mozilla emphasized that the changes aren't related to using data for AI or selling it to advertisers, ensuring data usage is within the Privacy Notice guidelines.

items.title: EVgo prohibits fast-charging extension cables and breakaway adapters
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- EVgo revised its terms of service on March 8th to ban the use of DC extension cables and breakaway adapters at its stations.
- The new policy prohibits any unauthorized adapters, continuing to allow only automaker-manufactured chargers.
- The ban impacts EV accessory makers like A2Z EV, which recently launched a DC extension cord for fast-charging stations.

items.title: All the news about EV charging in the US
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The electric vehicle (EV) charging landscape in North America resembles the smartphone charging wars, focusing on hardware compatibility.
- Tesla is opening its connector as the North American Charging Standard (NACS), countering the more widespread Combined Charging System (CCS).
- NACS is being standardized by SAE International, with major automakers like Ford, GM, and Toyota signing on to adopt it.
- A federal investment of $7.5 billion aims to improve EV charging infrastructure reliability across the U.S.
- Kia EVs will gain access to Tesla Superchargers in March 2025, with initial delays in the rollout.
- Mercedes-Benz vehicles will also gain access to Tesla's Supercharging network, starting in February 2025.

items.title: Apple’s AirTags are on sale for their best price to date
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Apple AirTags four-pack is on sale for $64.49, providing a savings of about $35.
- Individual AirTags are available for $22.99 (about $6 off).
- AirTags utilize the ultra wideband technology in newer iPhones for precision tracking and connect to the Find My network for locating out of range.

items.title: The Best Nintendo Switch Controllers to Buy Right Now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The default Joy-Cons are less comfortable for long sessions, especially for larger hands.
- Recommended controllers cater to different play styles, including TV and handheld modes.
- Top choices include the **Nintendo Switch Pro Controller** for TV mode, offering HD rumble and gyro motion support, and the **Hori Split Pad Pro** for handheld mode, which excels in ergonomics.
- **GuliKit KingKong 3 Pro** and **KingKong 3 Max** are highlighted as great Xbox-style controllers with extensive customization options.
- Third-party controllers may lack some features, like HD rumble and NFC support for Amiibo.
- Pricing varies, with some controllers generally being on the pricier side but considered worthwhile for comfort and usability.

items.title: The best indie games we’re playing right now
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Highlights a variety of indie games that are currently popular.
- Emphasizes the creativity and uniqueness of indie games compared to mainstream titles.
- List includes games like *Die in the Dungeon*, *While Waiting*, and *Spirit Swap* that offer innovative gameplay mechanics and narratives.
- The article will be updated frequently with new recommendations.

items.title: MWC 2025: all the phones, gadgets, and commentary from Barcelona
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Mobile World Congress 2025 will be held in Barcelona from March 3rd to March 6th, with announcements starting March 2nd.
- Companies like Xiaomi, HMD, and Honor are expected to unveil new devices, including Xiaomi's flagship 15 series.
- The show will focus on mobile technology and AI, even as its prominence has declined compared to past events.

items.title: Intel pushes Ohio chip factory opening to 2030
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Intel is delaying the opening of its $28 billion Ohio chip plants to between 2030 and 2031, pushed back from the initial plan of 2025.
- The second fabrication plant is not expected to open until 2032.
- Intel cites financial responsibility and customer demand as reasons for the delay, amidst ongoing financial struggles including mass layoffs and a major CEO change.

items.title: What to expect at MWC 2025
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2025 runs from March 3rd to March 6th, with announcements starting March 2nd.
- Xiaomi will launch its 15 series, including the regular 15 and 15 Ultra, focusing on photography with a 200MP lens.
- Nothing will unveil its 3A series on March 4th, featuring its first triple camera with optical zoom.
- Samsung may tease the Galaxy S25 Edge but no major announcements are expected.
- HMD has a press conference planned for March 2nd, possibly related to a new Nokia-branded device.
- Lenovo is anticipated to reveal various laptops including the foldable ThinkBook Flip.
- Honor will present its new corporate vision, the “Alpha Plan,” on March 2nd.
- Realme plans to launch its 14 Pro series and tease a new phone with premium features. 
- Tecno and TLC will also make announcements, focusing on camera technology and new phone releases.

items.title: All of the announcements from Amazon's Alexa Plus event
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Amazon is launching **Alexa.com** and a new app for **Alexa Plus**.
- **Alexa Plus**'s AI upgrades cost **$19.99** but are free with **Prime** membership.
- The new **AI-powered Alexa Plus** allows for more natural conversations and improved understanding of user commands.
- Alexa Plus will provide features such as ordering groceries, managing smart home devices, and summarizing documents.
- Early access to Alexa Plus will start in late **March 2025** for eligible **Echo Show** devices.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home offers convenience with features like smart lights and automated door locks.
- Complications exist due to various platforms and device interoperability issues, making smart home management challenging.
- A guide is provided for staying updated on smart home technologies and devices from leading companies such as Apple, Amazon, Samsung, and Google.
- The Eve Dimmer Switch with Matter over Thread functionality is set to launch for $49.95 in mid-March 2025.
- Amazon is expected to launch a major update to Alexa that includes improved voice recognition during an event this week.
- The new Ring Outdoor Cam Plus supports 2K video and is now available for preorder at $99.99, shipping on March 26, 2025.

items.title: Apple accused of misleading consumers with Apple Watch ‘carbon neutral’ claims
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Apple faces a class action lawsuit claiming it misled consumers regarding carbon neutrality of certain Apple Watch models.
- The lawsuit alleges that these products relied on faulty offset projects that did not effectively reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
- Plaintiffs argue they would not have purchased the watches or paid as much if they knew the claims were misleading.

items.title: Severance opens up a new kind of terror in latest episode
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The latest episode titled "Chikhai Bardo" explores Mark's reintegration after being severed from his innie.
- Flashbacks detail Mark's relationship with Gemma, who is revealed to be alive under Lumon's control.
- Gemma's transformation into Miss Casey involves disturbing psychological and physical tests by Lumon. 
- The episode raises questions about the ethics of Lumon's severance procedure and the existence of Gemma's fake death.
- The narrative deepens the horror of corporate control, suggesting that severance is more sinister than previously understood.

items.title: The High Stakes for AI Alexa
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Amazon is launching the most ambitious version of Alexa yet, aiming for a more integrated AI assistant experience.
- Alexa has been partially successful but has not yet achieved the omnipresence Amazon desires.
- The Vergecast discusses the future of Alexa, its new technologies, and user experience concerns.
- Other topics include a unique camera launch, updates about the iPhone 16E, and developments in podcasting platforms.

items.title: NHL officials will start wearing Apple Watches on ice
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- NHL officials will wear Apple Watches with custom NHL Watch Comms app for real-time game information.
- The app provides alerts for player penalties and game clock updates via haptic feedback.
- Watches synchronize with NHL's Oasis cloud feed for uniform data across all officials.
- Officials can choose between the Apple Watch Ultra or Series models tailored for in-game use.
- This collaboration follows previous partnerships including the use of iPads for game video since 2017.

items.title: Microsoft is shutting down Skype in favor of Teams
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft will shut down Skype on May 5, 2025, transitioning users to Microsoft Teams.
- Users can log into Teams to access message history, group chats, and contacts without needing a new account.
- Microsoft is phasing out support for calling domestic or international numbers and will no longer offer paid Skype features for new customers.
- Existing Skype users have around 60 days to switch to Teams or export their data, including photos and chat history.
- Skype credits will be honored, but users need to move their Skype Number to another provider as Microsoft stops supporting it.
- The decision stems from changing user trends and competition from services like Zoom, Messenger, and WhatsApp.

items.title: Meme coins aren’t subject to securities regulations, says SEC
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The SEC states meme coins do not qualify for federal securities law protections.
- New guidance suggests meme coins are akin to collectibles and do not generate income.
- Recent clarification may protect meme coin creators from legal issues and influence crypto regulations.

items.title: AMD Radeon RX 9070 and 9070 XT Pricing and Release Details
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- AMD’s Radeon RX 9070 and 9070 XT will launch on March 6th.
- Prices are set at $549 for the RX 9070 and $599 for the RX 9070 XT.
- The cards support 4K gaming at significantly lower prices compared to competitors like Nvidia’s RTX 5070 and RTX 5070 Ti.
- The RX 9070 XT is reportedly 51% faster than the RX 6900 XT and 26% faster than the RTX 3090 at 4K resolution.
- Both cards feature 16GB of GDDR6 memory and consume 220 watts of power.
- The new RDNA 4 architecture is expected to double the performance per compute unit compared to RDNA 2.
- AMD plans to support over 75 games with its new FSR 4 technology by the end of the year.

items.title: Elon enters the circus
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Elon Musk made a striking appearance at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), capturing audience attention with a chainsaw and a portrait of himself.
- His speech, described as incoherent by some, drew significant cheers and standing ovations from the crowd.
- Musk's role in the conservative movement raises questions about his political ambitions and the contradictions within the MAGA coalition.
- Artist Seth Leibowitz, who painted Musk’s portrait, expressed concerns over Musk’s ideas like transhumanism and his broader political aspirations, including plans for DOGE.
- CPAC reflects internal conflicts within the right, showcasing Musk as a central figure amid a backdrop of varying opinions from attendees.

items.title: Airbnb co-founder Joe Gebbia now works for DOGE
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Joe Gebbia joins President Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to improve the retirement process.
- Gebbia announced his new role, highlighting the importance of enhancing user experience in government.
- The US Office of Personnel Management processed a retirement application digitally for the first time, reducing processing time significantly.
- The specifics of Gebbia's involvement and whether it is a paid position are unclear.
- Gebbia remains a significant shareholder and board member of Airbnb, which faces backlash from users regarding his political affiliations.

items.title: EA Open Sources Four Command & Conquer Games
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- EA has released the source code for four Command & Conquer titles: Tiberian Dawn, Red Alert, Renegade, and Generals, available on [EA’s GitHub page](https://github.com/electronicarts/).
- This release is aimed at helping modders and the game restoration community; only the source code is open-sourced, not the game assets or cinematics.
- The new releases provide fully recovered source code for the original games, while Renegade and Generals are being released as open source for the first time.
- EA has also launched Steam Workshop support and released a 'Modding Support' pack for various C&C games to facilitate mod creation and sharing.

items.title: Aurzen Zip tri-fold projector review: mirror anything (without DRM)
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- The Aurzen Zip projector is priced at $249, featuring a compact design and quick connectivity via AirPlay and Miracast.
- It has a built-in rechargeable battery lasting about 80 minutes and can project on various surfaces.
- The projector struggles with DRM-protected content from services like Netflix and Disney Plus, limiting its streaming capability.
- It offers a maximum resolution of 720p with 100 ANSI lumens brightness, making it best for darker settings.
- Reviews highlight its portability and ease of use for casual media consumption and presentations, but note that the built-in speaker quality is poor.

items.title: The best ebook reader to buy right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Ebook readers provide a more immersive reading experience than phones.
- Key features to consider when choosing an ebook reader include display quality, weight, waterproofing, and note-taking capabilities.
- The **Kindle Paperwhite** is recommended for its superior display and features like waterproofing and warm lighting at a starting price of $160.
- The **Kobo Libra Colour** is highlighted as the best non-Amazon reader, known for its nice color screen and stylus support.
- For budget-conscious readers, the **Base-model Kindle** at $110 is recommended, offering a high-resolution display and USB-C for fast charging.

items.title: Kia’s next EV is the affordable, long-range EV4 sedan
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Kia announces the EV4 sedan and hatchback at the 2025 EV day event in Spain.
- The EV4 boasts a range of up to 630km on a single charge with an 81.4 kWh battery, and accelerates from 0-62 mph in 7.4 seconds.
- The sedan will be built in Korea and launch in March 2025, while the hatchback will be produced in Slovakia for a second half of 2024 release.
- Pricing for the EV4 will start at 37,000 euros (approximately $38,500) with an initial run of 160,000 units, including 80,000 for North America.
- The EV2 small electric SUV concept will follow in 2026, aiming for an even lower price point.

items.title: Meta’s AI chatbot will soon have a standalone app
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta is planning to launch a dedicated standalone app for its AI chatbot, aiming to reach users outside its existing platforms such as Facebook and Instagram.
- The app could launch in the second quarter of 2025, contributing to the trend of standalone AI applications.
- The AI chatbot has previously been integrated into Meta's existing applications and now offers features like answering questions, generating images, and providing personalized recommendations using its memory.
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has committed to a major investment strategy for AI, amounting to $65 billion, with an AI event scheduled for April 29, 2025.

items.title: Amazon CEO says ‘beautiful’ new Alexa hardware is coming this fall
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon plans to unveil a brand new lineup of devices in the fall that are described as beautiful, according to CEO Andy Jassy.
- The new hardware will support Alexa Plus, an upgraded version of the smart assistant capable of performing more tasks, launching soon at a cost of $19.99 per month or included with Prime subscriptions.
- Amazon is placing greater emphasis on displays with plans for future hardware, as evidenced by the recent launch of a larger 21-inch Echo Show.

items.title: Cricut’s new crafting machines are more accurate, faster, and cheaper
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Cricut unveiled the Cricut Maker 4 and Cricut Explore 4, the first updates in almost four years.
- The machines are faster, more accurate, and cheaper, starting at $249.99 for Explore 4 and $399.99 for Maker 4, available in sage and seashell colors.
- They will be released on February 28, 2025, and include materials for 10 initial projects.
- The new models boast speed improvements, up to twice as fast for thin materials, and a new optical sensor for better cutting accuracy in various lighting conditions.
- The Maker 4 supports over 300 materials, while Explore 4 handles around 100 materials.
- Past controversy arose from proposed subscription fees for design uploads, but those plans were scrapped after backlash.

items.title: Apple will let parents share their kids’ ages to limit app access
The best iPhones
The Best Android Phones
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Android ecosystem offers a wider range of devices compared to iPhone.
- AI features on Android are still developing; notable are Pixel's AI tagging and Galaxy's call translation.
- Top Android phones tested provide strength in hardware longevity, high resolution, and smooth refresh rates.
- Recommended features include an IP68 rating for durability and extensive software updates.
- Despite a variety of options in Asia and Europe, US consumers face limited choices, focusing on unlocked phones is advised.
- Key products highlighted include the Google Pixel 9, Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, and a compact Samsung Galaxy S25.

items.title: Microsoft releases a Copilot app for Mac
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has launched a native Copilot app for macOS, providing access to its AI assistant.
- Features include a dark mode, a shortcut command (Command + Space), and the ability to upload images and documents for assistance.
- The app will be available in the US, UK, and Canada, and includes document summarization features coming soon.
- Microsoft recently removed usage limits on Copilot Voice and Think Deeper for free users, allowing unlimited interactions with the AI.

items.title: OpenAI announces GPT-4.5, warns it’s not a frontier AI model
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- OpenAI launches GPT-4.5 as a research preview for ChatGPT Pro users.
- The model is designed to improve writing capabilities and world knowledge, but it is not classified as a frontier model.
- GPT-4.5 features improved computational efficiency and is trained using new supervision techniques and traditional methods.
- It exhibits significantly less hallucination compared to previous models and is stated to be a better collaborator.
- Following the Pro release, GPT-4.5 will be available for Plus, Team, Enterprise, and Edu users in subsequent weeks.
- The model is also accessible in Microsoft’s Azure AI Foundry platform.

items.title: Hands-on with Alexa Plus in the smart home
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The newly announced **Alexa Plus** introduces a more conversational and capable voice assistant for smart homes.
- Alexa Plus features **eight new voices** and improves natural language processing, allowing more intuitive commands.
- Users can create smart home routines using voice alone, simplifying device control without needing specific names.
- The **new Echo Show UI** will launch soon, offering a customizable interface with larger widgets.
- Alexa Plus integrates with **Ring's Smart Video Search** and enhances cooking controls for better recipe management.
- It costs **$19.99 a month** and will be part of Prime membership, with early access starting in late March in the US.

items.title: Sesame is the first voice assistant I’ve ever wanted to talk to more than once
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Sesame's voice assistant, Maya, leaves users wanting more conversation.
- Developed by a team including Oculus co-founder Brendan Iribe.
- Sesame is also creating AI glasses for all-day use with high-quality audio.
- Plans to open source models and support over 20 languages soon.
- A mini white paper on their technology is available on Sesame's website.

items.title: Meta is firing about 20 employees for leaking
The fallout of Meta’s content moderation overhaul
Here’s a new trailer for the ambitious survival game from PUBG’s creator
Jeff Bezos is sending Katy Perry to space
Microsoft pushes ahead with AI in gaming
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced its new AI model, Muse, which generates gameplay for Xbox games.
- Muse was trained on the game Bleeding Edge and understands 3D worlds and physics, raising concerns about AI replacing game developers.
- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella calls Muse a significant advancement, while game developers express fears about job security and the future of human creativity in gaming.
- AI tools are currently used by 49% of developers according to a recent GDC survey, leading to anxiety over layoffs in the industry.
- Microsoft plans to showcase AI advancements at the upcoming GDC, including discussions on AI's role in unlocking opportunities for players and game creators.

items.title: Powerbeats Pro 2 review: the workout buds to beat
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Powerbeats Pro 2 feature active noise canceling, transparency mode, and heart rate monitoring.
- Compact design with a case that's 33% smaller and buds that are 20% lighter.
- Battery life is improved, offering 10 hours on the buds and 45 hours total with the case.
- Priced at $249.99 and retains the IPX4 rating.
- Redesigned ear hooks for better comfort, especially for glasses wearers.
- Sound quality is improved, described as good for workouts but not audiophile-level.
- Heart rate monitoring works with multiple fitness apps but has limitations for iOS users.
- Wireless charging available, case size remains larger compared to competitors.

items.title: WD’s Xbox expansion cards are nearly matching their Black Friday low
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Western Digital’s WD_Black C50 Storage Expansion Card for Xbox is on sale for $109.99 (down from $157.99).
- The 2TB version is priced at $199.98, about $50 off.
- These expansion cards allow users to store and play games directly without data transfer, offering performance close to the console’s built-in storage.
- Feature Microsoft’s Quick Resume for simultaneous gameplay across multiple titles.
- Installation is easy with a plug-and-play design.

items.title: Shinichirō Watanabe’s Lazarus hits Adult Swim in April
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Shinichirō Watanabe’s new anime, *Lazarus*, will premiere on Adult Swim on April 5th.
- The show will have encores on Max starting April 10th.
- *Lazarus* features a narrative about a painkiller that is actually a deadly poison.
- Adult Swim president Michael Ouweleen commended Watanabe’s work on the show, describing it as a mix of great characters and directing.
- Watanabe hinted that *Lazarus* will reflect on the real-world opioid crisis.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article discusses the various impacts of Trump’s administration on the tech industry during his first 100 days in office.
- Significant changes in government policies affecting technological advancements and federal agencies are highlighted, including potential disruptions to Antarctic research due to administrative chaos.
- Elon Musk's involvement and influence is noted, particularly regarding the establishment of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and his controversial email to federal employees urging productivity.
- Apple is responding to tariff threats with a proposed $500 billion investment in the US, raising questions about the actual novelty of this commitment.
- Legal challenges against the manipulation of climate change references on USDA websites by the Trump administration are outlined, highlighting concerns over transparency and accountability.
- Various appointments and controversies surrounding governmental positions, including Dan Bongino's role as deputy FBI director and the implications of these on public trust in government agencies are examined.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs on China, Canada, and Mexico will take effect March 4th
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump confirms that 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico and an additional 10% tariff on Chinese imports will take effect on March 4th unless drug imports are stopped.
- Trump cites high levels of drug imports from Mexico and Canada, particularly fentanyl sourced from China.
- The tariffs had previously been paused for a month but are now set to resume as scheduled.
- Companies like Acer warn that the 10% tariff will result in price increases for laptops, and the auto industry expects significant impacts due to these tariffs.

items.title: Starlink poised to takeover $2.4 billion contract to overhaul air traffic control communication
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The FAA is close to canceling a $2.4 billion contract with Verizon to modernize air traffic control communication and may award it to Starlink.
- Concerns arise about favoritism and conflict of interest as Musk publicly critiques Verizon's system.
- A SpaceX team has been actively assisting the FAA to develop a safer air traffic control system and has recommended awarding the contract to Starlink.

items.title: Roblox is getting faster on Chromebooks
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox is launching an x86 version optimized for Chromebooks, promising up to 2x faster performance.
- Improvements include smoother gameplay and quicker load times, with frame rate increases of 99% for 'Adopt Me!' and 67% for 'Brookhaven RP'.
- Load times are expected to reduce by 54% and 55% for those games, though specific times are not provided.
- Chromebook players receive exclusive in-game items and a special Chrome jetpack for their avatars.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Automakers face significant impact from Trump’s tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China.
- A 25% tariff is threatened on chips, with higher rates possible in the future.
- Framework, a laptop manufacturing company, states limited impact from tariffs due to Taiwanese production; future pricing considerations are being evaluated.
- Acer announces a 10% increase in laptop prices in the US, attributing this to Trump's 10% tariff on imported goods from China.
- Small businesses are struggling with rising costs due to tariffs, forcing price increases.
- Big Tech companies remain silent about their responses to these tariffs, with ongoing uncertainties about the impact.

items.title: The Powerbeats Pro 2 can’t play music while tracking heart rate on gym equipment
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Powerbeats Pro 2 can connect to gym equipment to track heart rate but cannot play music simultaneously.
- Issue confirmed by Apple following a review by YouTuber DC Rainmaker.
- Heart rate tracking on iOS limited to seven partner apps; Android compatible with any app supporting Bluetooth heart rate trackers.
- Users of Apple Watch will see its heart rate data prioritized over Powerbeats Pro 2's data.
- Heart rate feature found to be unwieldy and not particularly useful for athletes preferring flexibility with peripherals.

items.title: Disney Plus is adding a bite-sized version of ESPN's SportsCenter
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Disney Plus will launch a new show called SC Plus, a bite-sized version of ESPN's SportsCenter, on March 3rd, 2025.
- SC Plus will provide a fast-paced update of the day’s sports highlights, featuring a top 10 format.
- Weekday hosts will be Gary Striewski and Randy Scott, while Hannah Storm and Jay Harris will host on weekends. Each episode will run for about 15 minutes.
- This initiative aims to attract more casual sports fans and continues to merge the content offerings of Disney Plus and ESPN Plus.
